I think it was in my second grade that I
was caught drawing the bust of a nude by
Michelangelo I was sent straight away to
my school principal and my school
principal a sweet
nun looked at my book with dis gust
flipped through the pages so all the
nudes you know I'd been seeing my mother
draw nudes and I copy her and the nun
slapped me on my face and said sweet
Jesus this kid has already begun I had
no clue what she was talking about but
it was good
enough but it was convincing enough for
me never to draw again until the nth
grade thanks to a really boring lecture
I started caricaturing my teachers in
school and you know I got a lot of
popularity I don't play sport I'm really
bad at sports I don't have the fanciest
gadgets at home I'm not on top of the
class so for me cartooning gave me a
sense of identity I got popular but I
was scared I'll get caught again so what
I did was I quickly put together a
collage of all the teachers I drawn
glorified my school principal put him
right on top and gifted it to
him he had a good laugh at the other
teachers and put it up on the notice
board this is a part part of that and I
became a school hero all my seniors knew
me I felt really special I have to tell
you a little bit about my my family
that's my mother I love her to bits
she's the one who taught me how to draw
and more importantly how to love she's a
bit of a hippie she said don't say that
but I'm saying it anyway the the rest of
my family are boring academics busy
collecting ivy league decals for our
classic Ambassador car my father's a
little different my father believed in
holistic approach to living and you know
every time he taught us he'd say I hate
these books because these books are
hijacked by Industrial Revolution while
he still held that world view I was 16 I
got the best lawyer in town my older
brother caric and I sat him down and I
said P from today onwards I've decided
I'm going to be disciplined I'm going to
be curious I'm going to learn something
new every day I'm going to be very
hardworking and I'm not going to depend
on you emotionally or financially and he
was very impressed he was all tearing up
ready to hug me and I said hold that
thought I said can I quit school
then but to cut a long story short I
quit school to pursue a career as a
Cartoonist I must have done about 30,000
caricatures I would do birthday parties
weddings divorces anything anyone who
wanted to use my services but most
importantly while I was traveling I
taught children cartooning and in
exchange I learned how to be spontaneous
and mad and crazy and fun when I started
teaching them I said let me start do
this professionally when I was 18 I
started my own School however an
18-year-old trying to start a school is
not easy unless you have a big Patron or
a big supporter so I was flipping
through the pages of the times of India
when I saw that the prime minister of
India was visiting my hometown
Bangalore and you know just like how
every cartoonist knows Bush here and if
you had to meet Bush it would be the the
funnest thing because his face was a
cartoonist Delight I had to meet my
prime minister I went to the place where
his hel helicopter was about to land I
saw layers of security I caricatured my
way through three layers by just
impressing the
gods but I got stuck I got stuck at the
third and what happened was to my luck I
saw a nuclear scientist that in whose
party I had done cartoons ran up to him
and said hello sir how do you do he said
what are you doing here ragava I said
I'm here to meet the Prime Minister he
said oh so am I I hopped into his car
and off we went through the L man
security thank you I sat him down I
caricatured him and since then I've
caricatured hundreds of celebrities this
is one I remember fondly Salman RI was
pissed off I think because I altered the
map of New York if you
[Laughter]
notice anyway the next slide I'm about
to show
you should I just turn that off anyway
the next slide I'm about to show you is

this cartoon was published soon after
9/11 what was for me a very naive

that evening I came home to hundreds of
hate males hundreds of people telling me
how they could have lived another day
without seeing this I was also asked to
leave the organization a cartoonist
organization in America that for me was
my lifeline that's when I realized you
know cartoons are really powerful art
comes with
responsibility anyway what I did was I
decided that I need to take a break I
quit my job with the papers I closed my
school and I wrapped up my pencils and
and my brushes and inks and I decided to
go traveling when I went traveling I
remembered I met this fabulous old man
who who I met when I was caricaturing
who was turned out to be an artist in
Italy he invited me to his Studio he
said come and visit when I went I saw
the ghastliest thing ever I saw this
dead naked Effigy of himself hanging
from the ceiling I said oh my God what
is that and I asked him and he said oh
that thing in the night I die and the
morning I am born again I thought he was
cuckoo but something about that really
stuck I loved it I thought there was
something really beautiful about that so
I said I am dead so I need to be born
again so I wanted to be a painter like
him except I don't know how to paint so
I tried going to the art store you know
there are 100 types of brushes forget it
they will confuse you even if you know
how to draw so I decided I'm going to
learn to paint by myself I'm going to
show you a very quick clip to show you
how I painted and a little bit about my
City Bangalore

they had to be larger than life
everything had to be larger the next
painting was even bigger and even bigger
and for me it was I had to dance while I

started painting dancers here for
example is a flamco Dancer except there

know I made some money sold my paintings
and i r rush off to France or Spain and

much as energy as I put into them while
making them they never danced so I
decided I had this crazy Epiphany at 2
in the morning I called my friends
painted on their bodies and had them
dance in front of a painting and all of
a sudden my paintings came alive and
then I was fortunate enough to actually
perform this in California with velocity

the audience and I saw my work come

here the work was coming alive and it
had some other artists working with me
the collaborative effort was fabulous I
said I'm going to collaborate with
anybody and everybody I meet I started

held in London the best collaboration of
caes with children they are ruthless
they're honest but they're full of

they taught me how to be cool I don't

bad then I said all this is good but I

American education is so

so close so one day I had the
opportunity to meet one of these guys
and I said how do you paint like that
who taught you you know and he said oh
it's very easy I can teach you but we're
leaving the city because billboard
painters are a dying extinct bunch of

I said in exchange for Education how to

a company and since then I've been

in fact I started painting on anything
and started sending them around town
since I mentioned my wife the most
important collaboration has been with
her NRA NRA and I met when she was 18 I
must have been 19 and a half then and it

she lived in America she'd come every
two months to visit me and then I said
I'm the man I'm the man and I have to
recipro reciprocate I have to travel
seven oceans and I have to come and see
you I did that twice and I went
broke so then I said Nate what do I do
she said why don't you send me your

sent the word Works to her that her
dad's friends like most of you are Geeks
I'm

she contacted anyone and everyone who

that's us in uh New York notice one

happened along the

we got and we said it's time to
celebrate and I said the best way to
celebrate is to marry NRA I said let's

let's invite everyone who's helped us
all the people who bought our work and
you won't believe it we put together a

bring them to India so a lot of them
were in India 150 artists V volunteered
to help me with my wedding we had
fashion designers installation artists
models we had makeup artists jewelry
designers all kinds of people working
with me to make my wedding an art
installation and I had a special
installation in tribute to my in-laws I
had the vegetable Carvers work on that
for me but but all this excitement led
to the Press writing about us we were in
the papers we still in the news 3 years
later but on unfortunately something
tragic happened right
after my mother fell very ill and my I
love my mother and and I was told all of
a sudden that she was going to die and
they said you have to say bye to her you
have to do what you have to do and I was
devastated I had shows booked up for
another year I was on a on a high and um
I couldn't I could not my life was not
exuberant I could not live this Larger
than Life person I started exploring the
darker abscesses of the human mind of
course my work turned ugly but another
thing happened I lost all my audiences
the Bollywood stars who I would party
with and and and buy my work disappeared
the collectors the friends the Press
everyone said nice but thank you no
thank you is more like it but um I
wanted people to actually feel my work
from their gut because I was painting it
from my gut if they they wanted Beauty I
said this is the beauty I'm willing to
give you it's politicized of course none
of them liked it my works also turned
autobiographical at this point something
else happened a very very dear friend of
mine came out of the closet and in India
at that time it was illegal to be gay
and it's disgusting to see how people
respond to a gay person I was very upset
I remember the time when my mother used
to dress me up as a girl that's me
there because she wanted a girl and she
has only
boys
and anyway I don't know what my friends
are going to say after this talk anyway
it's a secret and so after
this my Works turned a little violent I
talked about this masculinity that one
need not perform and I talked about the
weakness of male sex uality this time
not only did my collectors disappear the
political activists decided to ban me
and to threaten me and to forbid me from
showing it turned nasty and I'm a bit of
a chicken I can't deal with any threat
this was a big threat so I decided it
was time to end and go back home this
time I said let's try something
different I need to be reborn again and
I thought the best way as most of you
know who have children the best way to
have a new lease in of life is to have a
child I decided to have a child and
before I did that I quickly studied what
can go wrong how can a family get
dysfunctional and rudra was born that's
my little son and two magical things
happened after he was born my mother
miraculously recovered after a serious
operation and this man was elected
president of this country you know I sat
at home and I watched I tear up and I
said that's where I want to be so Nathan
and I wound up our life closed up
everything we had and we decided to move
to New York and this was just 8 months
ago I moved back to New York my work has
changed everything about my work has has

what the [ __ ] was I thinking it talks
about it talks about mental inest you
know I may appear to be a very nice
clean sweet boy but I'm not I'm capable
of thinking any
but my I'm very civil in my action I
assure
you these are just different cartoons
and before I go I want to tell you a
little story my I was talking to my
mother and father this morning my dad
said I know you don't want to you have
so much you want to say but you have to
talk about your work with children so I
said okay um I work with children all
over the world and that's an entirely
different talk but I want to leave you
with one story that really really
inspired me I met Belinda when she was
16 I was 17 I was in Australia and
Belinda um had cancer and I was told
she's not going to live very long um
they in fact told me 3 weeks I walk into
a room and there was a shy girl and she
was bald and she was trying to hide her
baldness I whipped up my pen and I
started drawing on her head and I drew a
crown for her and then we started
talking and we spent a lovely time at
told her how I ended up in Australia how
I backpacked and who I conned and how I
got a ticket and all the all the stories
and I drew it out for her and then I
left Belinda
died and and within a few days of her um
death they published a book for her and
she used my cartoon on the cover and she
wrote a little note she said hey Rags
thank you for the Magic Carpet ride
around the world for me my art is my
Magic Carpet Ride I hope you will join
me in this Magic Carpet Ride and and
touch children and and be honest thank
you so

much thank you so much
